intro: Conostylis spathacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf flax-lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. Conostylis spathacea is typically drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for various environmental conditions.
